posts.post_content:
**Aaron's Random Card Comment of the Day #35, 11/12/10**   
   
Many cards in the silver-bordered Unhinged set riff off of existing black-bordered **Magic** cards, but this one is a reference to a prior silver-bordered card from the *Unglued* set, [Look at Me, I'm the DCI](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Look at Me, I'm the DCI).
  
   
Whereas “the DCI” is a mysterious, shady front of an organization whose name used to be an abbreviation for something people no longer remember (and is now just a string of letters), “R&D” is a real, concrete body of actual humans, many of whom I have met. And R&D’s initials actually stand for something: Randy & Del.
  
   
Randy Buelher, former Director of **Magic** R&D, and his wife, Del Laugel, current Senior **Magic** Editor, are the first family of making **Magic**, so it makes sense that the department is named after them. The blue handwriting on this particular card is, in fact, Randy’s. (The red editorial markings on [Frazzled Editor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frazzled Editor), also in *Unhinged... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)*
posts.html:
Aaron's Random Card Comment of the Day #35, 11/12/10

Many cards in the silver-bordered Unhinged set riff off of existing black-bordered Magic cards, but this one is a reference to a prior silver-bordered card from the Unglued set, Look at Me, I'm the DCI.

Whereas “the DCI” is a mysterious, shady front of an organization whose name used to be an abbreviation for something people no longer remember (and is now just a string of letters), “R&D” is a real, concrete body of actual humans, many of whom I have met. And R&D’s initials actually stand for something: Randy & Del.

Randy Buelher, former Director of Magic R&D, and his wife, Del Laugel, current Senior Magic Editor, are the first family of making Magic, so it makes sense that the department is named after them. The blue handwriting on this particular card is, in fact, Randy’s. (The red editorial markings on Frazzled Editor, also in Unhinged... (see all)

posts.post_content: That's not a real Moat under it. New white mana symbols and Fifth Edition wide textbox don't work there. posts.post_content: I remember thinking this card took two mana, because on many older R and D cards the casting cost was listed as Number (total casting cost) and number of mana symbols. So 2WW would be the casting cost of white knight. That was a long time ago and this card is still good, mainly because of its many combo's (Uktabi Kong for infinite apes?)
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
*"1 equals 20 and Shower of Sparks... POW"*  
-DarkCerberusXX

posts.post_content:
Not something you want to leave in play without some enchantment-destruction in hand to stop opponents taking advantage of this. Play as part of a game-breaking combo, the turn you let it off.
  
Combo with Feral Lightning to make 4 4/1 Elementals, double all +1/+1 bonuses and -1/-1 penaltys, give yourself ANOTHER extra turn with Time Streatch, whatever you do, make it big and do it fast.
posts.html:
